MajorClaims.MC1: you should focus on what you are good at
MajorClaims.MC2: doing what you can already do well helps you make a big accomplishment and do it much better

Claims.C1: you will be more likely to accomplish your purpose by concentrating on what you do well
Claims.C2: by doing what you are good at, you will be better at it

Premises.P1: the more time you spend on what you do well, the more likely to achieve something great you will be
Premises.P2: Albert Einstein, one of the most competent physicians in history, devoted most of his life to develop theory in physics and finally established special and general relativity
Premises.P3: he hardly cared about something else
Premises.P4: It is said that, surprisingly, he never tried to distinguish a hand soup and a facial soup
Premises.P5: using two different soups properly was quite annoying
Premises.P6: Focusing what you are good at helps you attain your goal
Premises.P7: When you're doing something well, you will feel more satisfied and more interested in it
Premises.P8: you will motivate yourself to do more
Premises.P9: I used to be good at math when I was in junior high school
Premises.P10: I was really satisfied with the fact that I could do preferably
Premises.P11: I became to absorb myself to try more advanced level of math problems
Premises.P12: I could not only get higher scores in math test but also solve the university-level problems
Premises.P13: If you keep doing what you already do well, you can be better good at it
